title: 107_s1457
content:
FHA-insured multifamily housing mortgage and housing assistance restructuring. The Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997 is amended to make changes to various sections, including the insertion of "Federal Housing Administration of the" in section 571 and replacing references to the President with the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development in section 572. Sections 576 and 578 are repealed. The Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997 is amended to update the year from 2001 to 2004 in section 579. Additionally, changes are made to allow tenant groups, nonprofit organizations, and public entities eligible under section 517(a)(5) to also be eligible under section 514(f)(3)(A). Mortgage restructuring and rental assistance sufficiency plans can be requested by project owners for property sales or transfers under section 524(e). The Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997 is amended to update the year from 2001 to 2004. Changes allow various entities to be eligible for property sales or transfers under approved plans of action. The Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997 is amended to update the year from 2001 to 2004. Changes allow various entities to be eligible for property sales or transfers under approved plans of action. The Secretary will establish a percentage of fair market rent, with rents exceeding those of comparable properties in the same market area, as determined by an independent entity or the Secretary. In amendments to the Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997, changes include updating the year to 2004. Modifications allow eligibility for property sales or transfers under approved plans of action. Adjustments are made to sections regarding payment of claims and subparagraph redesignations. SEC. 2. Enhanced vouchers are amended to include rent limitations from the Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997. 

SEC. 3. A technical correction is made to Public Law 106-74, changing "514(h)" to "514(h)(1)" with retroactive effect.
